txt.en: The final stone has been placed on Humbald's grave.
'It is done. The fact they are gone seems a little more real now than it did earlier....\n\n'I need to go home and sit by a warm fire for a while.'
'I think most of the Reeve's family has gathered, and we are about to get started.'\n\n'Please, walk with me to the others.'
'Let us make our way to Thrymm's home in Forlaw.'
The final stone has been placed on Cynegar's grave.

'Rest in peace.'
'Humbald and Grimgar, sons of Gársig and Burghild.'
'They fought alongside their father at Scylfig.'
'They were young, but strong and brave and they died with honour as warriors.'
'They gave their lives to help save those who escaped Scylfig.'
'May they rest in peace.'
'My sons, the twins, Edsig and Gárferth.'
'Gársig was my youngest son, and he and I have not always seen eye-to-eye...'
'His heart was always in the right place, and his actions in Scylfig proved that.'
Instance: The Funeral in Forlaw
'I forgive him for what happened to Cuthbald, but more importantly...'
'Even the sky seems to be mourning today.'
'I am sorry to keep everyone waiting.'
'Let us begin.'
'Thank you, Cyneberg. Your help today is most appreciated.'
'The impact of what occurred in Scylfig and Forlaw will take time to sink in.'
'For us to recover from those we lost, will take even longer.'
'Today, we lay to rest the last of my sons; Edsig, Gárferth, Gársig and Thrymm.'
'I wish I could offer words of inspiration and hope...'
Every living member of Gárwig's family has come to the graveyard today to pay their respects and say good-bye to those they loved.
'And my grandsons, kinsmen to Gársig, Grimgar and Humbald.'
'...but I cannot muster much of either, these days.'
'And finally Cyneberg's father, my cousin and great friend, Cynegar.'
'There have been too many reasons for us to gather here of late.'
'My father, Cynegar, was a great leader for Scylfig.'
Every living member of Gárwig's family has come to the graveyard today to pay their respects and say good-bye to those they loved.
'He was a wonderful father, and mentor, for me and the people...'
Every living member of Gárwig's family has come to the graveyard today to pay their respects and say good-bye to those they loved.
'Cynegar gave his life to help save those who could escape.'
'There is no greater honour for a warrior and leader such as he...'
'Than to die protecting his home and family.'
'We will miss you, my old friend.'
'May he rest in peace.'
'Let us speak of my grandsons...'
The final stone has been placed on Thrymm's grave.
'Let us speak of Grimgar'
'Let us speak of Gársig...'

Many were lost in the battle at Scylfig, but none were more important to the people of Wildermore than their hero Thrymm Red-beard. A funeral is being planned by Gárwig and Cyneberg so that the people of Forlaw can pay their respects and say good-bye to those who lost their lives.
'Let us finish with Thrymm...'
'I am still in shock that both were taken from me, so suddenly.'
'They were both filled with promise, and had much to give back to Forlaw.'
'...But the enemy stole them from us, from me, before they reached their potential.'
'I will have to try hard to find comfort in the fact they died as guardians of Forlaw.'
'And despite the efforts of the enemy, they had an honourable death.'
'Let us speak of Cynegar...'
'I hope he forgave himself for what happened.'
You picked up the stone.
'I will miss you, my son.'
You picked up the stone.
'Thrymm Red-beard, Champion of Wildermore and greatest warrior of this land.'
'He was more than just our champion, he was a symbol of hope and courage.'
Listen to Gárwig speak about Thrymm
'He was and is beloved by the people of Wildermore.'
'And I hoped to someday make him leader of Wildermore, as my successor.'
Join Gárwig near the twins' graves
'Thrymm was my nephew, but I saw him as my son, and he looked to me as his father.'
'I cannot be more proud of the man he became, nor more saddened by his passing...'
'I love you Thrymm, and will miss you, forever.'
The final stone has been placed on Grimgar's grave.
'Let us begin with the twins...'
